SEARCH
Package org.fluentjdbc

Class DatabaseInsertBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseInsertBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatabaseUpdatable<DatabaseInsertBuilder>
@ParametersAreNonnullByDefault public class DatabaseInsertBuilder extends Object implements DatabaseUpdatable<DatabaseInsertBuilder>
Generate INSERT statements by collecting field names and parameters. Support autogeneration of primary keys. Example: 
 Long id = table.insert()
    .setPrimaryKey("id", (Long)null)
    .setField("name", "Something")
    .setField("code", 102)
    .execute(connection);

    • execute

      public int execute(Connection connection)
      Executes the insert statement and returns the number of rows inserted. Calls createInsertStatement() to generate SQL and DatabaseStatement.executeUpdate(Connection) to bind parameters and execute statement

    • setPrimaryKey

      @CheckReturnValue public <T> DatabaseInsertWithPkBuilder<T> setPrimaryKey(String idField, @Nullable T idValue)
      Adds primary key to the INSERT statement if idValue is not null. If idValue is null this will Statement.execute(String, String[]) to generate the primary key using the underlying table autogeneration mechanism

      Bug: This doesn't work for Android when idValue is null

      public DatabaseTable getTable()
